intro: Amphilophium oxylophium, commonly known as the white-flowered rock cress, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers are white or pale yellow, with four petals arranged in a typical cruciform shape, and it produces small, rounded pods containing several seeds.
